newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: S.Africa's Botha said set to marry.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa's Botha said set to marry.

text.p: Former South African president P.W. Botha, whose wife of 54 years died in June, plans to remarry at the age of 81, an Afrikaans-language daily reported on Thursday.
Beeld said neither Botha nor widow Reinet te Water Naude would confirm or deny the report that they were going to marry, which the newspaper attributed to friends of the family.
"Let's leave things in the hands of the Lord," Botha told the newspaper. "The bible says it's not good for people to be alone."
Asked about the Beeld report by The Star newspaper, Botha said only: "At the moment I am a lonesome warrior."
Botha was the last hardline apartheid president of South Africa and consistently refused to release Nelson Mandela, president since 1994, from his life sentence for opposing white rule.
Botha was ousted by reformist F.W. de Klerk in 1989 and retired to his southcoast holiday home in a resort called the Wilderness.
